Description: Brass (?) lamp on a tall stand; eight-spouted lamp with cockerels on each spout, and a lid which may not be original as it is loose fitting. The stand consists of a tall cylindrical shaft engraved with foliate medallions and inscription friezes, with baluster on either end. The stand sits on a three-footed base with concave-faceted top with similar engraved foliate medallions. The object may be composite, although wear and corrosion suggests that the individual pieces have been together for some time.
Curator's comments: Originally ascribed an 11th-12th century date but a slightly later date of the 12th-13th centuries is more likely.
Bibliographic references: Barrett 1949a / Islamic metalwork in the British Museum (pl.4a)
